stimulusHtml: A metal sphere with radius r1 has a total electric charge of magnitude q. An uncharged metal sphere with radius r2 (with r1 > r2) is then connected by a wire to the first sphere, as illustrated above. The separation of the spheres is much greater than the radius of either sphere. When equilibrium is reached, the spheres will have
choicesHtml: charges on their surfaces of equal magnitude and the same sign
charges on their surfaces of equal magnitude and opposite sign
